intro: Hydnocarpus curtisii var. sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran hydnocarp, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and spherical, woody fruits. The plant produces a milky latex, which has been historically used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
